item.title: Report E-2024060078
item.description:
Report E-2024060078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2734 Tri-Act 1825 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the wood trailer floor and tote body due to the cap coming off in transit. The cap was re-secured to the tote. The impacted tote and trailer floor were cleaned with pads and simple green. The impacted rags and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060084
item.description:
Report E-2024060084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN3266 Offense release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 20’ area of the concrete lot below. The pallet tipped over in transit due to improper loading. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and citric acid to neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallets were placed into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024060745
item.description:
Report X-2024060745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO THE EAST PRIMARY FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO OCNTAINERIZE THE LEAKING CONTAINER AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. CONTAINER AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON THE CONTAINER, MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND SOLIDIFIED, INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO ETT AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA, UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

GES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the lithium hydroxide-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN2922 Trumpet EC release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 2’ x 20’ area of the concrete dock due to a fork puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: BRYAN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LBY experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid pH Reducer release from multiple boxes each containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 3’ area of the concrete dock due to the jugs being crushed in transit. Sodium bicarbonate was deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. A total of (20) 1-gallon jugs, impacted cardboard, and impacted absorbents were collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWO experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct a tote transfer. Terminal personnel conducting initial cleanup of 1-gallon. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted pads and PPE into a cubic yard box. All rinse water used to decontaminate the tote and pump were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbents to the oxidizer-impacted dock floor and used a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents, and damaged product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNW experienced a UN2222 Rhodiasolv MPE XP release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 5/20/2024 at approximately 1430, Dangerous Goods Administation recieved a call from Employee 472710 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing one can of paint. The package appeared to show signs of spillage during sort. Further investigation revealed damage to the inner container, resulting in the dislodging of the closure causing spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's Declaration for further transport.

  • Description: On 5/29/2024 at approximately 0945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call fron Employee 3962724 at the ramp facility in Aguadilla, PR, reporting an environmentally hazardous substance spill. The shipmment consisted by 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing one plastic drum. The shipment appeared wet on the bottom. Furhter investigation revealed that the inner contents had indeed spill from the top due to mishandling. The entire shipment will be set for disposal, as it cannot move any further in the FedEx network.

item.title: Report E-2024050740
item.description:
Report E-2024050740

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HT driver stated that once he hooked up to take his paper work to his tractor when he heard a popping sound. Driver also stated that the when he was opening the external valve the handle felt different and it felt like it was coming out further than it should so he stopped opening He went to the back of the trailer and noticed the external valve had came out completely. He then went and hit the emergency valve but product continued to flow out until it finally stopped. HT notified the customer o the spill and the operator returned to the unloading area where he saw the external valve on the ground. HT driver had some product on his clothes and face. He was taken to the hospital for observation. HT driver did not have his hard hat on or face shield at the time

item.title: Report E-2024060138
item.description:
Report E-2024060138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: HAHNVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Friday, May 17, 2024, a Occidental Chemical driver made a delivery of Hydrochloric acid to the Occidental Chemical plant located in Hahnville, LA. The Occidental Chemical driver was loaded at an IMTT facility located in Geismar, LA. While the unloading process was underway, it was discovered that the bleeder valve on the product transfer line that goes to the product storage tank was left open. This resulted in approximately 2600 gallons of Hydrochloric acid being released from the product line into the containment area. No injuries or exposure to chemical occurred as a result of this event, as well as no off-site impact or environmental impact. The offloading process was halted, bleeder valve closed, containment area drained to sump for processing, and remainder of offload was completed.

  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 53ft-by-8ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that forty (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. Hepaco personnel used water to gather the released material and then deployed a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized along with impacted debris into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damage drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: The CTMV was travelling northeast on NC 222. The truck drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CTMV rolled onto the passenger side of the vehicle across NC 222. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil. The cost for the cleanup and remediation is still pending final notification from the contractor.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05-12-2024 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap during routine work operations at the CN Geismar Yard in Geismar, LA. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The responding CN DGO observed liquid dripping from the Bottom Outlet Valve cap (attached) with a strong vinegar type odor in the area. It was also noted that the valve handle was found to be in the fully closed position with a shipper supplied security seal intact. The bottom outlet valve cap was checked for tightness with a pipe wrench and was found to be loose (easily able to turn with a pipe wrench). The bottom outlet valve did not create a liquid tight seal while in the closed position in conjunction with an improperly tightened securement cap allowed the contents to leak out onto the ground. The rail car has a faulty bottom outlet valve and will be transloaded in a shipper provided rail car. The leaking rail car will require an OTMA 1 to move to home shop for a qualified inspection and repair/requalification.

item.title: Report X-2024060343
item.description:
Report X-2024060343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: DESTREHAN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05-06-2024 an FRA Hazardous Materials Safety Inspector performed a regulatory compliance check on tank car CGTX 31156 (Last Contained, Diesel Fuel, UN 1202, Class 3, PG II) at the CN Destrehan Yard in Destrehan, LA. The inspection revealed that (8) of (8) manway cover swing bolts were not properly fastened, the 2" vapor valve was in the fully opened position with it's securement plug not attached, the 3" liquid valve securement plug was not attached. The inspector also noted a diesel type odor upon opening the protective housing. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer of the findings. The CN DGO requested the tank car be placed on an accessible track for further investigation. The responding CN DGO did not detect any diesel type odor upon opening the protective housing. A (4) gas with PID gas monitor was placed at the opening of the fully opened 2" vapor valve for several minutes. There were no detectable LEL or VOC readings emanating from the open valve or within the protective housing cover. The gas monitor was also placed next to the un-secured manway cover for gas detection purposes. There were no LEL or VOC's detected. The vapor valve was closed, and its securement plug was applied utilizing a 24" pipe wrench. The liquid valve securement plug was applied utilizing a 24" pipe wrench. The (8) manway cover swing bolts were tightened with a 24" pipe wrench. The placards on the tank car (combustible liquid) were not consistent with the shipping papers (flammable liquid) and were replaced. CGTX 31181 On 05-06-2024 an FRA Hazardous Materials Safety Inspector performed a regulatory compliance check on tank car CGTX 31181 (Last Contained, Diesel Fuel, UN 1202, Class 3, PG II) at the CN Destrehan Yard in Destrehan, LA. The inspection revealed that the bottom outlet valve cap was less than tool tight (could be turned by hand), (8) of (8) manway cover swing bolts were not properly fastened, the 2" vapor valve was not in the fully closed position with it's securement plug not attached, the 3" liquid valve securement plug was not attached. The inspector also noted a diesel type odor upon opening the protective housing. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer of the findings. The CN DGO requested the tank car be placed on an accessible track for further investigation. The responding CN DGO did not detect any diesel type odor upon opening the protective housing. A (4) gas with PID gas monitor was placed at the opening of the partially open 2" vapor valve for several minutes. There were no detectable LEL or VOC readings emanating from the open valve or within the protective housing cover. The gas monitor was also placed next to the un-secured manway cover for gas detection purposes. There were no LEL or VOC's detected.

item.title: Report E-2024060002
item.description:
Report E-2024060002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: WEST WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was delivering Caustic Soda 50% Diaphram to a customer in West Warwick RI on Tuesday morning 5/7/24. Univar Solutions' Driver called dispatch on arrival to customer to report a small release. Driver reported the gasket was pinched on the dome manway which allowed product into the spill box of trailer. Driver backed into the unloading area and noticed a trail of caustic drips leading down the pavement into customer's unloading area. Driver pulled the trailer out of the pitched area to refasten the dome gasket. Driver got the customer's employee to review the release. Customer personnel cleaned up the drips with rags and water. An incident report was filled out and signed by customer. Further investigation indicated the air valve was open on the trailer and Driver did not conduct a thorough pre trip on the trailer catching the open air valve. The released product at the customer was a result of the open air valve and not the dome gasket.

He then called our emergency response number and 911 approximately 1825 CT. Local fire showed up and a container was put under the valve that was leaking. Federal, State, and Local EPS agency's were notified ant approximately 1845 CT We dispatched a team to the scene they arrived at approximately 2130 CT. item.title: Report X-2024051794
item.description:
Report X-2024051794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4-29-2024 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve, loading equipment was observed to still be attached with the cap dangling during routing work operations at the CN Sioux City Yard in Sioux City, IA. The employee initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car has been set out on an isolation track (SC98) The transportation Employee placed a bucket underneath the rail car to contain the leak. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found loading equipment was still attached and the cap was not attached but dangling by the chain. The attached loading valve was less than tool tight leaking from the threads. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The loading equipment valve was removed from the car and the bov valve was observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. The bottom outlet valve cap gasket was inspected and replaced. The BOV cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, eight (8) one-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately 0.2 gallons of product to the trailer floor and cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted material were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 11 :40 PM on 04/29/24, notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Sulfuric Acid, Spent) from the top and down the side. The car was located in our Manchester Yard and our contractor, Haz-Mat Special Services, was called to repair it. HMSS identified the issue as two bolts on the top loading valve were less than too-tight. HMSS was able to tighten the bolts to spec and resolved the leak.

item.description:
Report X-2024060420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS STOPPED FOR AN INSPECTION DUE TO THE BOX HAVING A HANDWRITTEN MARKING STATING BATTERY POWERED OPEN WHEN IT ARRIVES. THE OUTER BOX HAS A STICKER APPLIED HANDLE WITH CARE, DELICATE INSTRUMENTS, AND FRAGILE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE FLUKE 732B DC STANDARD CALIBRATION DEVICE CONTAINING A SEALED LEAD ACID (NON-SPILLABLE) GEL BATTERY INSIDE THE DEVICE. A STICKER ON THE DEVICE INDICATES BATTERY REPLACED 2022-05-04. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NONSPILLABLE BATTERY IS NOT INDICATED ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024060459
item.description:
Report X-2024060459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE LVD PICK OFF ON THE PD-4. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF THE POWER AND SECURED THE CONVEYOR BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS PH TESTED AND CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS SLIGHTLY LOOSE, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1123 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1123-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, as well as the impacted pallet, and damaged product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums which were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: AIR PACKAGE TO PUERTO RICO HAD BROWN PAPER COVERING THE ENTIRE BOX. DURING PACKAGE HANDLING SOME OF THE PAPER WAS TORN EXPOSING A CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABEL. FURTHER REMOVAL OF THE PAPER REVEALED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKING OF UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PI 965 IA AND NET WEIGHT 21.03KG. THE BOX IS ALSO UN SPECIFICATION. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER BOX CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE ECOFLOW DELTA MAX (2000) PORTABLE POWER STATION. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RY6239, GATORADE SPORTS, 404 W HARRISON, CHICAGO IL 60607.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was punctured due to an unknown cause and released approximately 50-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt/gravel below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel performed a tote transfer and labeled the tote for onsite disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the released product. All waste was containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SOUTH SORT AISLE. THE SORTER NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE SIDE OF THE BOX. THERE WAS A MILD ODOR COMING FROM IT. HE STOPPED, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED DMP SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. DETERMIND TO BE A POSSILE UNDECLARED SHIPMENT.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 2-gallon plastic jerrican. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a granular absorbent and neutralizer to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged jerrican was placed into one (1) additional 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024060019
item.description:
Report I-2024060019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES -ROSALIND SHELMIRE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, HOLUB/ALEXEIDAVID, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft Iav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft Iav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward Iav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution. Name: Alex Eidavid Holub Address: 36 Mayflower Drive Wenham MA 01984 , Phone: 626-676-1736 Email: alexholub@gmail.com

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A MULTIPLE PACKAGE AIR SHIPMENT WAS NOTED ON THE THERMAL LABELS TO CONTAIN 13 TABLETS. PACKAGES WERE SET ASIDE FOR OPEN BOX INSPECTION. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS ALL NINE PACKAGES CONTAINED THIRTEEN SAMSUNG GALAXY FESTIVAL POINT OF SALE MOBILE PAYMENT TABLETS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1Z6R58830195457796, 1Z6R58830196536458, 1Z6R58830196095845, 1Z6R58830199530672, 1Z6R58830196800019, 1Z6R58830196648060, 1Z6R58830196827625 AND 1Z6R58830197226237.

item.description:
Report X-2024051808

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: Welshpool
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/29/2024 at approximately 0800, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from Employee 4992313 at the ramp facilty in Welshpool of an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The shipment consists of one fiberboard box, containing 4 individual bottles of retail perfume. The accompanying safety data sheet incorrectly identified the commodity as "body lotion". The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, as it was not properly marked and label, and did not have the required packaging and paperwork. The shipment was discovered via x-ray at customs, prompting the opening of the pacakge for verification. The shipment to being prepared for disposal.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED ON THE EXTENDO ON DOOR 3, EMPLOYEE NOTICED THAT IT WAS LEAKING. THEY TURNED THE BELTS OFF AND NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. UPON ARRIVING TO THE LEAKING PKG THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER INSPECTED AND THE ODOR WAS VERY NOXIOUS AND FOLLOWING HIS DECISION TREE NOTIFED THE SUPERVISOR AS WE DO NOT HAVE SCBA. THE AREA WAS CORDONED OFF AND WE OPENED ALL THE DOORS FOR VENTILATION. WE THEN NOTIFIED BASE AND AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO CLEANUP THE SPILL.

item.title: Report X-2024060112
item.description:
Report X-2024060112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/19/24, we received notification from hub personnel that a foul odor was emitting from ISO tank SUTU 266444. The tank was labeled with the commodity "POLYSULFIDE 9. MARINE POLLUTANT" (UN 3082, HAZMAT), prompting to call out an environmental contractor United Pumping to assess the incident. The responder discovered several loose bolts on the top manway hatch. The product inside the tank appeared to be stable, with no residue or spillover on the top area of the tank. It seems the loose bolts found on the top hatch cover allowed vapor to escape, causing the foul odor. After tightening the bolts, the odor dissipated over some time. The seals on the top hatch remained intact and undamaged.

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: Manuelito
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 235000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: X-2024051203: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. NATX 400688 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The car suffered a 19"x2" heat-induced tear on the "B-end". This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051204: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 952565 suffered jacket damage and some dents. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, the tank suffered what appears to be a heat-induced tear measuring about 6"x1" on the top of the tank, underneath the jacket. The tank also had a significant blister at this point as well. Significant heat damage to protective housing as well. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051207: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 955642 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The tank suffered a puncture/tear toward the A-end of the car measuring about 2'x3'. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051208: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 954193 suffered jacket damage and some dents on each end, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. The protective housing also had significant damage. This car had burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051209: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 959911 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a significant B-end head dent, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051210: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 953969 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a dent on each end, but no container failure. This car did have multiple PRD venting cycles due to being exposed to heat/fire for hours. This car was liquid flared and then vapor flared to remove all remaining product.

Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and placed the clean up debris and the damaged metal pail into one 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060074
item.description:
Report E-2024060074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: LANTAU
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING NORMAL HANDLING PROCESS AT THE UPS HONG KONG INTERNATIONAL CHEK LAP KOK FACILITY ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM HONG KONG DESTINED TO THE USA WAS OBSERVED SMOKING ON THE BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY TAKEN AWAY FROM THE BELT AND PLACED IN A SEGREGATED AREA. THE SMOLDERING INCREASED AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE PACKAGE BEGAN BURNING. UPS STAFF USED A FIRE EXTINGUISHER TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE. THE EVENT WAS DISCOVERED PRIOR TO THE PACKAGE BEING LOADED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED A DANGEROUS GOODS ACCEPTANCE AUDIT PRIOR TO THE LITHIUM BATTERY INCIDENT. THE PACKAGE WAS FULLY DECLARED WITH AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AS UN3480 LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965. AFTER THE EVENT WAS EXTINGUISHED, THE OPERATIONS NOTED THE INNER THREE BATTERIES WERE NOT PROPERLY SEPARATED OR PROTECTED. ADDITIONALLY, NO WATT HOUR MARKINGS WERE FOUND ON THE BATTERIES. PER 49CFR 171.15, THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER WAS CONTACTED BY TELEPHONE TO REPORT THE INCIDENT. THE OFFICER WAS UNABLE TO ACCEPT THE TELEPHONE REPORT DUE TO THE EVENT NOT OCCURRING IN THE USA.

  • Description: Exterior packaging was wet on one side and on the underside by a thick clear liquid that came from the inside of the package. Inside the 4G box are 4 quantities of 1 gallon plastic bottles containing SEK-Surebond SB-8700 Wet Look Joint Stabilizing Sealer with Anti-fungal. One of the bottles had a streak of liquid leaked on to its body that is coming from under the cap. When the cap was opened, the seal was opened a quarter of the way. The liquid leaked inside the exterior packaging and hardened in an hour. The rest of the bottles were unharmed.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3149 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew tightened the cap and utilized absorbent pads to remediate the release. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged jug was overpacked into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024051843
item.description:
Report X-2024051843

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found by Ops Admin ID9160575 leaking on Belt 1 around 8:20am at back of Belt. Manager ID2546442 was questioned about origin of damaged hazmat. Manager stated hazmat package came down from overhead belt At beginning of sort around 4:50am damaged and leaking. She let package ride to the back of sorting belt to await Admin arrival for her work area. Management or present QA in other work areas were not notified of the damaged Hazmat. She stated she forgot to tell admin for her work area when admin arrived around 5:45 to work area. Package sat at back of belt on rollers for approximately 4 hours. Upon discovery by Ops Admin around 8:20am Package was immediately taken to QA area for processing. Upon inspection discovered 2 containers of Chem-Aqua had loose caps and leaked approximately 2 quarts of liquid into box and on exterior of containers.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/19/2024, during boarding phase of flight DL453(ATL-SAN), a passengefs bag in the overhead bin at seat 10C was observed to be smoking along with a loud"pop" noise. The bag was removed and placed in the jetway where AFD discovered that the heat source was a camera battery. AFD extinguished the battery and TechOps was tasked with disposal. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No Flight Crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with granular absorbents. The spent absorbents were gathered, and the recovered material and damaged pail was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS NO CUSTOMS INVOICE WITH THE SHIPMENT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 77R96A, VORO MOTORS, INC., 14350 ARMINTA ST, PANORAMA CITY CA 91402-6869.

The original package also appears to have been undeclared.
